# Geographic Facets
## Case: Australian Population Breakdown by Age

***

# Load data
## Subsection

```{r}

aus_pop_df <- read.csv('archetypes/aus_pop.csv')
aus_pop_df

#as.data.frame(get_grid_names())

```


# Plot
## Theme


```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, class.source = 'fold-hide'}

# theme parameters
theme_opts <- theme(
  legend.position = "bottom",
  legend.title = element_blank(),
  axis.text = element_blank(),
  axis.line = element_blank(),
  axis.ticks = element_blank(),
  axis.title = element_blank(),
  panel.grid = element_blank(),
  panel.grid.major = element_blank(),
  panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
  panel.background=element_rect(fill="white", colour="white"),
  panel.border = element_blank(),
  plot.background = element_blank(),
)

```


## Geo-Facet
## Question: How populated are states of Australia by age?

```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, class.source = 'fold-hide', fig.width=12, fig.height=6, out.width = "100%"}

v1 = ggplot(aus_pop_df, aes(age_group, pop / 1e6, fill = age_group)) +
  geom_col() +
  facet_geo(~ code, grid = "aus_grid1", label = "name") +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(
    title = "Australian Population Breakdown",
    caption = "Data Source: ABS Labour Force Survey, 12 month average",
    y = "Population [Millions]") +
  theme_bw()

v1

```


## Save output to file


```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, class.source = 'fold-hide'}

ggsave(filename = "assets/australian-population-breakdown.svg", plot = v1, width=12, height=6)

```
